page.title: 01THE NORMAN CONQUEST.
page.content: On the 14th October 1066 a great battle was fought between William of Normandy and King Harold.The English and Norman armies met at William's newly-established headquarters at Hastings.King Harold did not have luck on his side as the South coast,where William landed,was not defended as King Harold's Norwegian brother-in-law was trying to take England from the North.So after beating the Norwegians the English army had to march down to Hastings.On the south coast William,eager to lead his men,leapt out his boat and rushed up onto the beach but he slipped and his men thought this must be a bad omen,but events later in the day show that that was not so.At 9 o'clock the Norman army was deployed trumpets sounded then the terrible battle started.
